lead_paragraph: World Wrestling Entertainment Inc. suspended two performers for what it said were violations of its substance-abuse and drug-testing policy. Chris Mordetzky, known as Chris Masters, was suspended 60 days for his second violation. Harry Smith, who wrestles under the name D. H. Smith, was barred for 30 days for an initial violation. In July, traces of injected testosterone and painkilling drugs were found in the body of Chris Benoit. Benoit, 40, a performer for eight years, committed suicide in June after killing his wife and 7-year-old son in their Atlanta home, the police said.
